intro: Cynoglossum nebrodense var. natolicum, commonly known as the Sicilian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in summer. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
